title: Geography Vocabulary
description: Test your knowledge of geographic features, landforms, and map terms â€” from 'isthmus' to 'plateau'!

questions.question: What is an 'isthmus'?
options: A narrow strip of land connecting two larger land areas

questions.question: What does 'plateau' refer to?
options: A flat, elevated area of land

questions.question: What is a 'peninsula'?
options: A piece of land almost entirely surrounded by water

questions.question: What does 'latitude' measure?
options: Distance north or south of the Equator
Distance east or west of the Prime Meridian

questions.question: What is a 'delta' in geographic terms?
options: A landform created by sediment deposited where a river meets a body of water

questions.question: What does 'topography' refer to?
options: The arrangement of natural and artificial physical features of an area
The art of photography from above

questions.question: What is a 'strait'?
options: A narrow passage of water connecting two larger bodies of water

questions.question: What does 'longitude' measure?
options: Distance north or south of the Equator
Distance east or west of the Prime Meridian

questions.question: What is a 'tributary'?
options: A stream or river that flows into a larger river
A tax paid to a king

questions.question: What does 'tundra' refer to?
options: A vast, flat, treeless Arctic region with permanently frozen subsoil

questions.question: What is a 'gorge'?
options: A narrow, steep-sided valley, often carved by a river

questions.question: What does 'equator' refer to?
options: The deepest part of the ocean
An imaginary line around the middle of the Earth, equidistant from both poles

questions.question: What is a 'savanna'?
options: A grassy plain with scattered trees, found in tropical and subtropical regions

questions.question: What does 'cartography' mean?
options: The science and art of making maps

questions.question: What is a 'watershed'?
options: An area of land that drains all rainfall and snowmelt into a common outlet
